did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY

origination.label: Creator:

corpname.normal: Forest Hills Gardens Corporation (Forest Hills, New York, N.Y.)

origination.corpname: Forest Hills Gardens Corporation (Forest Hills, New York, N.Y.)

did.physdesc: 29.4 cubic ft., 1 reel positive, 2 reels negative microfilm.
Correspondence, minutes, reports, memoranda, vouchers, orders, notices, clippings, specifications, and other materials.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection includes materials relating to the history of Forest Hills Gardens, a planned residential community in Queens, New York that was devleloped by the Russel Sage Foundation in 1908.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Forest Hills Gardens is a planned residential community which was developed by the Russell Sage Foundation in 1908. Laid out on 175 acres in Queens, New York, the community's site plan was designed by Frederick Law Olmsted; many of the houses were designed by Grosvenor Atterbury.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, minutes, reports, memoranda, vouchers, orders, notices, clippings, specifications, and other materials pertaining to Forest Hills Gardens meetings, committees, director, constitution and by-laws, insurance and liability, finance, maintenance, development, construction, zoning, maintaining architectural standards and aesthetic control, building restrictions and waivers, streets and parking, complaints, policies, the sale of property to "undesirables," the Ives-Quinn anti-discrimination bill, and other subjects. Also included are reports of the Architectural Committee and correspondence with the Russell Sage Foundation, the Sage Foundation Homes Co., Forest Hills Dwellings, Inc., residents, and the New York City Planning Commission.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Forest Hills Gardens Corporation (Forest Hills, New York, N.Y.)
Forest Hills Gardens Corporation. Architectural Committee.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Corporate minutes: access restricted to permission of donor.

altformavail.head: Available Copies:
altformavail.p: Corporate minutes, 1922-1958 are on microfilm. Originals retained by donor.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Forest Hills Gardens Corporation Records, #2775. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: See also Forest Hills Gardens (New York, N.Y.) Records, ( #2495).

odd.p: Materials in Box 28, where noted, pertain to the development of the Vanderveer Tract, which adjoins Forest Hills Gardens and over which FHG has architectural control as per agreement of May 17, 1923

emph.ref: Series I. Alphabetical Files and Other Correspondence
Series II. Vouchers, Permits, and Legal Documents
Series III. Maps, Plans, Oversized Items, Brochures, and Glass Plate Negatives

did.unittitle: Captain Gerald MacDonald - A Biographical Memorial

scopecontent.p: Leather bound volume prepared for MacDonald Family and privately printed by the American Historical Society, Inc. N.Y. 1930. Former Forest Hills resident (house may have been on site of present Kennedy House on Queens Boulevard)

A collection of early views of Forest Hills Gardens, 1913 to approximately 1920, primarily of the Forest Hills Inn, Station Square and Flag-pole Green at the time of the July 4th celebrations. Observance of this Holiday was very important and was a day long event beginning with a sunrise proclamation by a Town-crier dress in costume (see photo) and continuing with a parade, games, dances, speeches, and a flag raising ceremony at Flag-pole Green

The Perry Collection #3442, 7-74 case 3, has a box with a collection of 37 lantern slides used by Mr. Perry for lectures on city planning Aug. 1, 1946. Fourteen of these slides are of Forest Hills Gardens, showing early views of Station Square dated July 1914 and of the July 4, 1914 celebration (similar to #28-41 in Box 30, #2775). Also, included is an early landscape overview of the Terraces (and Block 12) looking east from the Forest Hills Inn and an early view of the Olivia Park. A slide of an entrance gate to the Gardens is also included

did.unittitle: 2-27 - Spectators, games, races, flag raising ceremonies in Flag-pole Green on occasion of 4th of July celebration earlier - some Atterbury row houses visible on Greenway Terrances
28-41 - July 4th celebration observances in Station Square and Forest Hills Inn area - speaker shown in #28 and #29, may be Teddy Roosevelt, a frequent visitor to Forest Hills Gardens
42-72 - Young dancing girls performing outdoors in July 4th celebration events
77 - View from Burns Street towards Square
78 - Early view from Terraces into Station Square ca.
84 - Street lantern affixed to Forest Hills Inn in Station Square area
85 - Lantern light fixture near Forest Hills Inn in Station Square area
86 - Greenway Terrace group of row houses (Atterbury)
91 - Atterbury house corner of Greenway North and Overhill Road
92 - Early grandstands at West Side Tennis Club before tennis stadium was built
93 - Early photo of West Side Tennis Club before the stadium was built
